actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an insured individual otherwise qualified may retire and receive full old-age benefits, at any time after attaining age 60, if he has been forced to retire at that age by a Federal law, regulation, or order.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Provides, under title II of the Social Security Act (Old-Age, Survivors' and Disability Insurance) that an insured individual otherwise qualified may retire and receive full old-age insurance benefits at any time after attaining age 60, if he has been required by his employer (after having been employed by such employer for 5 or more years) to retire at such age in compliance with (1) an Executive order of the President; (2) a regulation or order issued by a Federal department or agency and published in the Federal Register; or (3) a Federal law. Prescribes special rules for determining eligibility for benefits in the case of dependents and survivors.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an insured individual otherwise qualified may retire and receive full old-age benefits, at any time after attaining age 60, if he has been forced to retire at that age by a Federal law, regulation, or order.
